quiz.text: Approximately by what percent the total number of members in all the 3 families together was increased from 2015 to 2020?
options: 37%
41%
33%
45%
30%

quiz.text: Find the ratio of the total age of all the members of family A to the total age of all the members of family B in 2020.
options: 93: 94
57: 75
24: 23
62: 47
3: 4

quiz.text: Find the average age of all the members of all the 3 families in 2015 (approximately).
options: 28.5 years
25.3 years
32.7 years
21.4 years
35.8 years

quiz.text: Find the ratio of the average age of family A in 2018 to that of family C in 2018?
options: 425: 329
170: 97
255: 188
85: 47
340: 281

quiz.text: In family B, if a baby was born in 2022, then what will be the average age of family B in 2025?(approx.)
options: 20.85 years
32.85 years
24.85 years
30.85 years
28.85 years

quiz.text: There are five students in a class, S1, S2, S3, S4 and S5. Average score of the class in the unit test is ______, while average score of S1 and S3 together is _____ more than average score of S2 and S4 together. Score of S3 is 50% more than S5, while the score of S2 is 12 less than S5. Score of S4 is _____ more than S5. Marks obtained by S5 _______ Find which of the following blanks will satisfy the blanks in the same order. I. 36, 9, 18, 30 II. 18.6, 3, 8, 20 III. 58, 5, 2, 60
options: I only
III only
II only
I and III only
None of these

quiz.text: The average weight of the first eight students is 150kg, the average weight of the last ten students is 10 more than the average weight of first eight students. The average weight of the rest two students is 300 kg. The average weight of all the students is ____kg. Then the 40% of the weight of all the students is ____kg.
options: 175 kg and 55 kg
172 kg and 60 kg
164 kg and 79 kg
170 kg and 68 kg
None of these

quiz.text: Total number of students in class A and B are same and average number of boys in both the classes 80 which average number of girls in both the classes are 40. Boys in class A is ___ while difference between boys and girls in class B is ____ and ratio of boys to girls in class A is 7: 5. Which of the following value will fill the blanks given in the question in the same order? A: 80 and 70 B: 60 and 50 C: 70 and 60
options: None
Only B
Only B and C
Only A and B
Only C

quiz.text: Average height of 64 children is 114 cm. If ____ children of average Height ____ cm are included then average height of group is increased by 2 cm. Which of the following values fill the blanks in same order? I. 10, 128 II. 4, 148 III. 8, 120 IV. 16, 124
options: I and III only
II and III only
I and II only
III and IV only
None of these

quiz.text: Ravindra Jadeja played ‘n’ number of T20 internationals in 2020. His batting average increased by 10 runs if first 5 innings not included, and his batting average is decreased by 10 runs if last five innings not included. If his average score of first 5 T20 innings is 80 and last T20 innings is 120, then find the value of (20% of a + n2 + 25).
options: 170
290
280
270
None of these

quiz.text: There are 5 consecutive odd numbers and 4 even numbers. Then find the difference between the highest and lowest odd numbers. Statement I: Average of the five consecutive odd numbers is x. The average of the first two consecutive odd numbers is (x-3) and the average of the last two consecutive odd numbers is (x+3). Statement II: The sum of the five consecutive odd numbers is x less than 1/3rd of the second highest even number and the sum of the four consecutive even numbers is 356.
options: The data in statement I alone is sufficient to answer the question, while the data in statement II alone is not sufficient to answer the question
The data in statement II alone is sufficient to answer the question, while the data in statement I alone is not sufficient to answer the question
The data either in statement I alone or in statement II alone is sufficient to answer the question
The data given in both statements I and II together are not sufficient to answer the question
The data given in both statements I and II together are necessary to answer the question

quiz.text: All odd multiples of a prime number less than 20 but more than 10 are arranged in ascending order (up to 100) and then added up. What is the average of all the odd multiples of the prime number?
options: The average of the first two even multiples is 39.
Number of odd multiples is one more than number of even multiples
If all the multiples are arranged in ascending order, the third multiple is less than 50 but the fourth multiple is more than 50.
Sum of all the multiples of the number is 364.
None of these

quiz.text: Find the average age of P, Q, R, S and T. I. Age of P is 25% less than the age of S. Age of R is 20% more than the age of T. II. Age of Q is 3/2 of the age of P. Ratio of the age of Q and R is 3:4. III. Age of T after 5 years is equal to the age of R after 1 year. Age of P before 2 years is half of the age of Q after 2 years. IV. The sum of age of P and Q is 10 years less than the sum of age of R and S.
options: Only I & II are sufficient
Both II & IV are sufficient
Both II & III are sufficient
Both I & II are sufficient
None of above.

quiz.text: The average weight of all members in a group is 150 kg. If weight of two members is decreased by 36 kg and 52 kg then the average weight of all members becomes 148 kg. If average weight of all members arranged in ascending order, then it becomes an arithmetic progression. The lowest weight in a group is 33.33% less than the highest weight. Which of the following statement(s) is/are can be determined? I). Highest weight in a group II). Total members in group
options: I only
II only
Neither I and II
Both I and II
Either I or II

quiz.text:
X numbers are selected and the average of these X numbers is M. On adding a number Y to these X numbers, the average becomes 49. What is the numerical value of Y?

A. X: Y = 40: 9

P. Y is 22.50% of X.

B. M = 50

Q. M = X + Y + 1
options: Only “A and P”
Both “B and P” and “A and Q”
Both “A and Q” and “A and P”
Only “B and Q”
Both “A and Q” and “B and Q”

quiz.text: Quantity I: The average weight of 6 students is 18 kg, another 4 students is 32 kg and another 8 students is 20kg. What is the average weight of all these students? Quantity II: For what value of y, the expression (y – 22)(y – 30) is less than zero.
options: Quantity: I > Quantity: II
Quantity: I ≥ Quantity: II
Quantity: I < Quantity: II
Quantity: II ≥ Quantity: I
Quantity I = Quantity II or relation can't be established

quiz.text: The average weight of A, B and C is 11kg, that of C and D is 14.5kg and that of D and E is 21kg. Weight of A is half of B and weight of C is 2.5 times of A.  Quantity I: What is the weight of B and D? Quantity II: What is the weight of C and E?
options: Quantity: I > Quantity: II
Quantity: I ≥ Quantity: II
Quantity: I < Quantity: II
Quantity: II ≥ Quantity: I
Quantity I = Quantity II or relation can't be established

quiz.text: Quantity I: A student finds the average of five two digit numbers. If one number is reversed and the average is taken again then average is decreased by 1.8. If all five digits are consecutive multiple of four, then find the number which is reversed?   Quantity II: Average weight of a group is 40kg. When two people include in the group average becomes 42kg after that when 3 another people removed from the group, having weight 20kg less than the weight of two person included previously, average weight becomes 44kg. Find the strength of group initially.
options: Quantity: I > Quantity: II
Quantity: I ≥ Quantity: II
Quantity: I < Quantity: II
Quantity: II ≥ Quantity: I
Quantity I = Quantity II or relation can't be established

quiz.text: Quantity I: Average age of Nitu, Rekha and Shyam is 17 years. Two new persons Divya and Raju joined them so that average age of all become 19 years. If Divya is 2 years older than Raju and Rekha is 2 years older and 1 year older than Shyam and Nitu respectively. What is sum of the average age of Nitu and Shyam together and average age of Divya and Rekha together?   Quantity II: The average age of father, mother and their two sons is 27.5. Five years ago, the ratio of ages of father, mother and two sons (elder and younger) is 7:5:2:1. Then find the sum of ages of two sons after 7 years.
options: Quantity: I > Quantity: II
Quantity: I ≥ Quantity: II
Quantity: I < Quantity: II
Quantity: II ≥ Quantity: I
Quantity I = Quantity II or relation can't be established

quiz.text: Quantity I: Average weight of a group of 6 children is 24 years. From the group, two children whose weight were 4 years more and 6 years more than average weight left. 4 new children whose average weight is 5 years more than the given average weight join the group. Find the new average.   Quantity II: The average age of mother, father and son was 49 years at the time of the marriage of son. After one year, an infant was born in the family and after 6 years of the marriage of son, the average age of the family is 40.4 years. What was the age of bride at the time of marriage?
options: Quantity: I > Quantity: II
Quantity: I ≥ Quantity: II
Quantity: I < Quantity: II
Quantity: II ≥ Quantity: I
Quantity I = Quantity II or relation can't be established

quiz.text: Income of P is Rs. 2000 more than Q, while combined income of P and R togeher is 26000. Combined income of P and Q is 200% more than R. Find the average income of P, Q and R together?
options: Rs. 13333.33
Rs. 13336.33
Rs. 13339
Rs. 13363
None of these

quiz.text: Total expense of a boarding house are partly fixed and partly varying linearly with the number of boarders. The average expense per boarder is Rs. 700 when there are 25 boarders and Rs. 600 when there are 50 boarders. What is average expense per Boarder when there are 100 boarders?
options: Rs. 560
Rs. 580
Rs. 550
Rs. 450
None of these

quiz.text: Height of B is 4 cm more than that of A and height of D is 4 cm more than that of C. Average of the heights of C and D is 8 cm more than that of A and B. If sum of the heights of A and C is 332 cm, then find the average of heights of A, B, C and D?
options: 164 cm
168 cm
162 cm
174 cm
170 cm

quiz.text: Average mark of 40 students in a class is 78. But marks of one student were written as 43 instead of 68. Find the correct average marks in the class?
options: 77.375
78.625
77.625
79.625
None of these

quiz.text: A, B, C and D are four different numbers each of which is neither less than 20 nor more than 40. The HCF of A & B is 7 and that of C&D is 3. The LCM of A, B and C is 840 while that of B, C & D is 9240. If the value of A is 4 more than that of C, what is the average of B and D?
options: 37
34
41
54
65
